level.text: All staff training shall be specific to the ages and characteristics of the residents served by the independent living program.
A new staff member of an independent living program shall receive pre-service training.
6326.3 The pre-service training required by § 6326.2 for new staff shall be for at least twenty (20) hours and include:
The independent living program’s administrative structure, procedures, and overall program;
The independent living program’s emergency plan as required by § 6335;
Communicable diseases and universal precautions;
Conflict resolution; and
An introduction to daily living skills for adolescents and young adults.
A staff member shall receive at least forty (40) hours of annual in-service training.
Annual in-service training shall include:
The independent living program’s emergency plan as required by § 6335;
The principles and practices of resident care, including appropriate training on age-specific and special physical, emotional, and medical needs;
Life skills as set forth in § 6330;
The independent living program’s administrative structure;
The independent living program’s policies and procedures as set forth in § 6307.2(n);
For the administrator, clinical director, social workers, and counselors appropriate techniques of behavior management and discipline pursuant to § 6347;
For the administrator, clinical director, social workers, and counselors techniques and methodologies of crisis management;
Child development;
Methods of working with adolescents and young adults that take into account their culture and interests;
Manifestation of and techniques for working with abused, neglected, and traumatized residents;
The independent living program’s discipline policy, including acceptable methods of discipline;
Recognition and prevention of abuse, neglect, and risks to the resident’s health or safety;

The independent living program’s procedures for reporting actual or alleged resident abuse or neglect, and actual or alleged risk to a resident’s health or safety, as set forth in § 6304, including training on mandatory reporting, and policies and procedures relating to child abuse or neglect and risks to residents’ health or safety;
Recognition of substance abuse symptoms and treatment resources;
Universal precautions;
Recognition of mental heath disorders and treatment resources;
Suicide prevention;
Depression; and
Topics determined jointly by the independent living program and CFSA.
An independent living program shall maintain records of attendance at training.
